title: Interaction-Centered Language Instructional Design for Distributed Learning Reinforcement

context.additional_context: Requires optimized design for learner-content/peer/teacher interactions in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can establish self-directed learning plans by utilizing over 80% of functional elements in language learning interfaces
Learners improve language application skills by 30% through collaborative problem-solving with peers in PBL activities
Learners can interpret and apply over 70% of complex language principles using generative instructional strategies (concept mapping, case analysis, etc.)
Learners increase learning engagement by 25% while recognizing social presence through feedback exchanges with instructors

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
